metadata.section_heading: Chapter 4

content:
Introduction
By opening this book, you have already made an important step toward
succeeding in managing your time for self-education. This book is
completely different from other books about time management; although
there are thousands of books on the topic, almost all of them contain very
similar techniques and methods, such as to-do lists, prioritization, strategic
planning, and so on. These are good and well-known traditional tools that
haven’t changed for half a century. But for the last ten years, technological
progress has significantly changed time management by creating new
methods and tools for managing time that were not widely available before.
In this book, you will not read about the traditional techniques of time

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p9_c0
metadata.section_heading: Introduction

content:
methods and tools for managing time that were not widely available before.
In this book, you will not read about the traditional techniques of time
management. However, you will learn about the new advanced method for
managing your time, which is not widely known. This method is used by
only a few of the most successful people around the world.
A few months ago, I contacted Jay Samit, the author of the book Disrupt
You! and the serial entrepreneur who is widely recognized as one of the
world’s leading experts on disruption and innovation. He has launched
billion-dollar businesses, transformed entire industries, and revamped
government institutions. I was interested in creating online education
products and  asked Jay about the main trends in education. He told me to

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p9_c1
metadata.section_heading: Introduction

content:
government institutions. I was interested in creating online education
products and  asked Jay about the main trends in education. He told me to
look at some universities and global education projects, such as Khan
Academy. I analyzed these universities and projects, and it brought me to
the conclusion that education around the world has changed significantly in

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p9_c2
metadata.section_heading: Introduction

content:
the last decade. I was able to underline two major trends in education that
have emerged only recently.
Firstly, education is becoming cheaper and more available to everyone.
Secondly, nowadays everybody with gadgets and internet access can obtain
knowledge and qualifications on the same level as graduates of the world’s
top universities. What does this mean for those who seek to invest their
time wisely and value every second? It means that time has become more
valuable because the opportunities for investing in time have substantially
increased and become more effective. When I asked Jay Samit about his
most important piece of advice for managing time, he replied, “Focus your
time on things that capture value and on things that can't be delegated. Don't
micromanage the details.”

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p10_c0
metadata.section_heading: the last decade. I was able to underline two major trends in education that

content:
time on things that capture value and on things that can't be delegated. Don't
micromanage the details.”
Today, like no other time before, two people with the same abilities can
achieve vastly different levels of personal success. Seemingly small
differences in the usage of a couple of hours a day can lead one person to
knowing a foreign language and the other one to expertise in liking friends’
photos on Instagram.
Nowadays, every second matters. There has been no such time in history
when one can gain access to knowledge shared by the world’s smartest
people almost anywhere and anytime. Technological progress has
dramatically changed the art of time management.
After finishing this book, you will completely change your view of time.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p10_c1
metadata.section_heading: the last decade. I was able to underline two major trends in education that

content:
dramatically changed the art of time management.
After finishing this book, you will completely change your view of time.
You will be able to manage it like the most successful people in the world
and learn faster than most people on the planet.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p10_c2
metadata.section_heading: the last decade. I was able to underline two major trends in education that

content:
Chapter 1
The Method
If you put as much time into designing your future as your interior, imagine
what you could achieve. –Jay Samit
Three years ago, I was faced with a problem. I spent every day commuting
to my university for more than two hours. During that time, I listened to
music, not even realizing that there were such things as audio books. I was
frustrated that I spent so much time commuting and intuitively felt like
something was wrong. I started to blame my circumstances; I thought that I
lived too far from the university. I began to hate the time when I was in
transport; I just did not know what to do. But one winter day, while looking
at my smartphone, I accidently found a podcast named Knowledge for Men.
I started listening to this podcast, which consisted of interviews with

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p12_c0
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 1

content:
at my smartphone, I accidently found a podcast named Knowledge for Men.
I started listening to this podcast, which consisted of interviews with
successful people. After that day, I no longer listened to music on my
commute; I listened to these interviews and gained knowledge.
It was my first experience with “switching” time. After a while, I began
listening to audio books every day. As a result, I read dozens of books a
year, gaining knowledge and expertise in economics, finance, psychology,
self-development, and so on. Thus, I turned my commuting time into
educational time, and the most boring moments of my day turned into the
most fascinating. I realized a problem and created an opportunity. This

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p12_c1
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 1

content:
seemingly small change in my everyday life led to the transformation of my
life and my perception of time. I started looking at time differently.
Modern technological devices allow for many opportunities to invest time
more easily. Today, people can download on their gadgets hundreds of
books and educational courses. Technology enables us to use our time
effectively and to invest in self-education in situations that were impossible
to do so just a decade ago.
It does not matter whether you are at home, in an office, on the go, in line,
or in an airplane; you have an opportunity to use this time and invest it in
your future. We live in the age of information and knowledge. That is why
the implementation of traditional methods of time management is not

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p13_c0
metadata.section_heading: seemingly small change in my everyday life led to the transformation of my

content:
your future. We live in the age of information and knowledge. That is why
the implementation of traditional methods of time management is not
sufficient. The rules have changed. The world has become much more
competitive.
The method of time switching will enable you to learn faster and surpass
most people in the quest to acquire knowledge. This method will allow you
to find a few additional hours a day that were previously invisible. These
hours are still invisible to the majority of people. This method is simple to
understand but not easy to implement.
There are a few unsystematic techniques related to this method that are
presented in some books and courses. However, to this day, there has been
no unified and well-presented concept pertaining to this method because, as

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p13_c1
metadata.section_heading: seemingly small change in my everyday life led to the transformation of my

content:
presented in some books and courses. However, to this day, there has been
no unified and well-presented concept pertaining to this method because, as
was mentioned above, there were no such opportunities for investing time
even a decade ago.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p13_c2
metadata.section_heading: seemingly small change in my everyday life led to the transformation of my

content:
The method of time switching is a unique system that allows you to see and
use time periods that were not noticed before. Now, let’s take a closer look
at your time that you do not use for education, work, or socializing with
friends. What do you do during this time? In the morning and in the
evening, you brush your teeth, you commute to your workplace, you wait in
line in some café, you wait for your friend, and so on. Now, try to answer
the following question: How many hours a year do you spend in transport,
brushing your teeth, waiting, and just walking down the street? Obviously,
it is hundreds of hours. What if I told you that there are people who invest
this kind of “unnoticed” time in themselves? Have you ever wondered how

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p14_c0
metadata.section_heading: The method of time switching is a unique system that allows you to see and

content:
it is hundreds of hours. What if I told you that there are people who invest
this kind of “unnoticed” time in themselves? Have you ever wondered how
it is possible that a person can know many foreign languages and have deep
domain expertise in some field while living in the same 24-hour period as
you? In answering this question, you can begin to understand the essence of
the time switching method.
The method of time switching is based on the evidence that there is time in
our day that we are able to “switch” to engage in self-education without
bringing any harmful effects to what we are already doing. For example, if
you are waiting in line, you can just pull out your smartphone and read an
e-book or listen to an audio book or podcast without any negative
consequences.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p14_c1
metadata.section_heading: The method of time switching is a unique system that allows you to see and

content:
e-book or listen to an audio book or podcast without any negative
consequences.
Now think about your day again, and try to take a different look at it. What
time periods would you effectively “switch” to self-educate without
experiencing any negative consequences?

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p14_c2
metadata.section_heading: The method of time switching is a unique system that allows you to see and

content:
Chapter 2
Time We Didn’t Notice
The chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be
broken. –Warren Buffett
When I go to the hospital, I often see people there waiting and doing
nothing. They wait to see a doctor for many minutes, sometimes for hours,
and do not do anything. Some of them are just sitting and looking at the
wall; others are texting and checking out their phones. But very rarely do I
see people reading a book on their phones or tablets or using this time
effectively.
Let’s think about places where people tend to sit and wait, and let’s analyze
what they are doing. Do you see many people gaining knowledge and
investing in themselves while they wait? A while ago, I used to wait and do

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p15_c0
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 2

content:
what they are doing. Do you see many people gaining knowledge and
investing in themselves while they wait? A while ago, I used to wait and do
nothing during my daily commute. Just five years ago, I did nothing while
waiting. But when I began to see time differently, I started the process of
changing the habits of my mind. I started rewiring my brain.
There are four main types of situations in which you can use the method of
time switching:
Commuting Time
You can listen to audio books while you are in a car, in a bus, on a plane,

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p15_c1
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 2

content:
Waiting Time
You can read books or listen to audio books using you smart phone or tablet
while you are waiting in different situations.
Eating Time
You can learn a few words from a foreign language while you eat. Three
words a day lead to more than a thousand words a year. This is a good way
to learn a language.
Exercise time
Make a habit of listening to audio books or watching educational videos
while walking or running on a treadmill.
Additionally, take advantage of the extra time you have while you generally
get ready in the morning—putting on clothes, applying makeup, washing
your face, shaving, etc. For example, you can listen to an audio book while
taking a shower and brushing your teeth.
How much time do we spend commuting every day? The average

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p16_c0

content:
taking a shower and brushing your teeth.
How much time do we spend commuting every day? The average
commuting to work in the United States is 25.4 minutes, according to the
U.S. Census Bureau (project.wnyc.org). And as you can suppose, most
people do not invest this time in themselves.
How much time do we spend waiting? This is harder to estimate, but there
are some weeks in which we spend hours just waiting. And again, most
people do nothing to invest in self-education while they wait. They are busy
texting, checking their social media, etc. However, a small percentage of

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p16_c1

content:
people invest in their future by utilizing all of their waiting time to self-
educate.
Eating and getting ready in the morning take many minutes out of our day.
During these times, we can also invest up to an hour a day studying and
learning. For example, I study Chinese and use this time to learn several
Chinese characters a day. Thus, I have substantially increased my pace of
mastering a difficult-to-learn foreign language.
Now let’s consider a hypothetical example and assume that on average,
some person spends one hour a day commuting, five minutes a day waiting
and half an hour a day eating. This implies that every day, this person can
use one hour and thirty-five minutes of their time for self-education. In this

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p17_c0
metadata.section_heading: people invest in their future by utilizing all of their waiting time to self-

content:
use one hour and thirty-five minutes of their time for self-education. In this
example, the person is able to invest more than five hundred hours a year in
studying a language, reading books, creating a business, and obtaining
knowledge and expertise in any field, thus enhancing the opportunity to
increase their income.
Think about your time once again. How many minutes do you spend on the
activities mentioned in the example? How many hours a day could you
invest in developing yourself and your life?

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p17_c1
metadata.section_heading: people invest in their future by utilizing all of their waiting time to self-

content:
Chapter 3
Preparation
Knowledge isn’t power until it is applied. –Dale Carnegie
One day, two successful entrepreneurs and business partners were playing
basketball. One of them asked his friend a few advanced questions about
accounting. The friend could not answer, so he changed the subject of the
conversation to avoid embarrassing the friend. A few months later they met
again, and he once more inadvertently asked the friend a question about
some aspect of accounting. But this time, the friend knew almost everything
about accounting. The friend said that after their previous meeting, he had
bought one of the best books about accounting and read the book every day
while brushing his teeth.
What does this story show us? It reveals that every second matters. It also

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p19_c0
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 3

content:
while brushing his teeth.
What does this story show us? It reveals that every second matters. It also
demonstrates how creative successful people are in the art of switching their
time to engage in self-education. For effective use of your time and to
implement the method of time switching, you need to make some important
preparations. Firstly, you must choose the field you will be studying while
using this method. Secondly, you need to find and prepare information for
studying. Download books and audio books to your gadgets, and print out
cards with text for studying. Be creative, and remember that the process of
preparation can take time and effort, but you will build an important
foundation for investing your time in a most significant way.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p19_c1
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 3

content:
For instance, I usually prepare cards with Chinese characters for learning. I
use the cards while brushing my teeth and eating. I also download hundreds
of books to my gadgets so I am able to switch time for the purpose of self-
education while commuting, waiting, walking, and so on.
What would you like to start studying? What foreign language do you want
to learn? Now you have no excuse. Now you can start because you have
time; you know how to switch it.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p20_c0
metadata.section_heading: For instance, I usually prepare cards with Chinese characters for learning. I

content:
Chapter 4
The Concept of Everyday Structures
Step by step you get ahead, but not necessarily in fast spurts. But you build
discipline by preparing for fast spurts. –Charles Munger
If we write down all the tasks that we do every day, we may notice that
there are some tasks that are repeated day after day. There are also everyday
routines that don’t get reflected in our list of tasks. 
Almost every person has a type of daily schedule characterized by morning
and evening routines. People have a tendency to do a particular set of
activities at the same time every day. For instance, one person may be used
to watching TV in the evening, while another person reads a book during
this time. Such tendencies can be referred to as habits, but this is not quite

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p21_c0
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 4

content:
this time. Such tendencies can be referred to as habits, but this is not quite
accurate since habits are broader by definition.
Everyday routines form the structure of our days and, as a result, the
structure of our lives. This is why I call them everyday structures. An
everyday structure (ES) is a set of habits, routines, and practices that is
responsible in part for our successes in life. However, most people don’t
form their ESs proactively.
In general, the Pareto principle implies that for many processes, activities,
and events, about 80% of the effects come from 20% of the causes. For

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p21_c1
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 4

content:
example, in sales it is commonly thought that 80% of a company’s sales
come from 20% of its clients.  
The concept of ES is based on the propensity for people to form a particular
type of daily schedule; accordingly, the Pareto principle implies that 20% of
what we do in our day accounts for 80% of the results that we see. So, if we
sleep 8 hours a day, then we have 16 hours left to accomplish things.
Sixteen hours times 20% equals 3.2 hours; this means that approximately
3.2 hours are responsible for 80% of the day’s results. Using this simple
method, you can accurately calculate your most important hours, but on
average, the number won’t differ too much from 3 hours.
These hours make up one’s ES. Surely, we do many structured activities all

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p22_c0
metadata.section_heading: example, in sales it is commonly thought that 80% of a company’s sales

content:
average, the number won’t differ too much from 3 hours.
These hours make up one’s ES. Surely, we do many structured activities all
day long that take up many more hours of our day, but not all the activities
that we repeat day after day are included in our ES. Although we don’t
include all recurring activities into our ES, this doesn’t mean that they are
inefficient or unimportant. The key is to understand which of the recurring
activities are the most relevant and can act as a first domino that will cause
other dominos to fall. After choosing such kinds of everyday tasks, we
package them into an ES. And as stated above, an ES only makes up about
3.2 hours of our day. This doesn’t mean that every day is the same and that

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p22_c1
metadata.section_heading: example, in sales it is commonly thought that 80% of a company’s sales

content:
package them into an ES. And as stated above, an ES only makes up about
3.2 hours of our day. This doesn’t mean that every day is the same and that
we don’t have to plan our days at all; we should plan as usual, but those
hours that form our ES are repeated day after day up to the point that they
become automatic. Thus, we have a strictly fixed ES and usual working
hours. In other words, an ES brings balance between stability and
spontaneity in our day.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p22_c2
metadata.section_heading: example, in sales it is commonly thought that 80% of a company’s sales

content:
To better illustrate the essence of this concept, I will share with you the
basic formula of my own ES. My ES consists of the following basic
everyday tasks and routines:
one hour of reading books in the morning;
two hours of learning Chinese in the evening;
five minutes of planning in the evening.
As you can see, my ES takes about three hours from my day, and it is aimed
at self-education. The learning and planning components are extremely
important, but you can change your ES by including some additional work
hours in it.
Here is another example of how you can form your ES:
two hours of working on your most important project in the
morning;
one hour of reading books in the evening;
five minutes of planning your next day in the evening.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p23_c0
metadata.section_heading: To better illustrate the essence of this concept, I will share with you the

content:
morning;
one hour of reading books in the evening;
five minutes of planning your next day in the evening.
Now, think about your own ES. What tasks and routines would you include
in it? Have a brainstorming session and create a list of tasks that could be
included in your ES.
Key Principles of Everyday Structures
Time Periods in the Morning and in the Evening
If we suppose that our free time is mostly in the morning and in the
evening, then it follows that this time can be highly controlled, and you can
use this time for creating new habits and everyday routines that will form

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p23_c1
metadata.section_heading: To better illustrate the essence of this concept, I will share with you the

content:
your ES. Basically, these few hours of your day that you spend in the
morning and in the evening are the key elements of your ES.
Proactive Approach
Most people don’t value their time properly and definitely don’t think that
just a few hours a day can change anything in their lives. This is why so
many people in their free time watch TV for hours, play computer games,
and so on. This is a reactive approach.
A proactive approach implies that you are responsible for your own life and
that you proactively design your ES in a way that maximizes your potential
and probability of success.
Long-Term Thinking
Long-term thinking is necessary for designing an effective ES. Since the
tasks involved in your ES repeat day after day and require patience and

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p24_c0
metadata.section_heading: your ES. Basically, these few hours of your day that you spend in the

content:
Long-term thinking is necessary for designing an effective ES. Since the
tasks involved in your ES repeat day after day and require patience and
consistency, you should have a clear vision of your end goal. Create a
strategy for ten years, and choose the most important goal you want to
achieve in ten years. On the basis of your most important goal and your
strategy, you will develop a highly effective ES that will maximize your
chances for success.
Knowledge Acquisition Component
Learning is a necessity for striving in today’s world. Include at least one
hour of learning in your ES. One of the most successful business coaches in
the world, Brian Tracy, emphasizes the importance of the golden hour, one
hour in the morning that we devote to self-education.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p24_c1
metadata.section_heading: your ES. Basically, these few hours of your day that you spend in the

content:
Planning Component
Failing to plan means planning to fail. Daily productivity and effectiveness
is directly correlated with your ability to write detailed plans for the next
day. So, incorporate everyday planning into your ES.
Flexibility Principle
Although your ES should not change very often, it is important that you
carefully analyze your current situation and adapt effectively. If you decide
to change some components, then don’t hesitate. It is vital to understand
that your ES is for structuring your life, and when your goals change, you
should change your ES accordingly.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p25_c0
metadata.section_heading: Planning Component

content:
Chapter 5
Self-Motivation: Behavioral Approach
Process of Self-Motivation Based on Science
Behavioral economics, social psychology, and other social sciences study
the patterns of human behavior, the underlying principles of human
perception, and the processes of decision making. Contrary to classical
economics, which implies that people are purely rational and make choices
based on rational calculations, behavioral economics models come from
real-world evidence and real human behavior. According to Richard T.
Thailer, the author of the book Misbehaving: The Making of Behavioral
Economics and one of the first behavioral economists in the world, human
behavior is characterized by the aspect of bounded rationality, which,

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p26_c0
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 5

content:
Economics and one of the first behavioral economists in the world, human
behavior is characterized by the aspect of bounded rationality, which,
among other things, implies that human rationality is bounded or influenced
by many factors that make humans irrational (Thailer, 2015). There are
many scientific papers and books about the factors that influence people to
make irrational choices, and many of them are of high practical value for
businesses, which specialize in sales and persuasion. For example, the most
popular book on this subject is Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion.
This book uncovers and describes the six ways to influence people or to
protect oneself from being influenced (Cialdini, 2009). However, the most

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p26_c1
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 5

content:
This book uncovers and describes the six ways to influence people or to
protect oneself from being influenced (Cialdini, 2009). However, the most
exhaustive list of the tendencies of human behavior was made by Charles T.
Munger and presented in 1995 during his speech at Harvard University. At
this speech, Munger presented 25 “standard causes of human

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p26_c2
metadata.section_heading: Chapter 5

content:
misjudgment”; these are also known as the 25 cognitive biases or 25
cognitive tendencies (Munger, 1995).
All these factors of bounded rationality in most cases lead us to irrational
choices and behaviors. Nonetheless, we can use these factors to influence
and motivate ourselves in highly subtle and powerful ways. To put it
differently, we can employ the factors of our irrational behavior to act more
rationally. This book provides some of the most substantial ways to
motivate yourself based on scientifically proven patterns of human
behavior.
Reward Bias
Lead and motivate yourself with rewards. Reward bias is often considered
the most powerful part of human motivation. Create a reward system for
yourself. Reward yourself at the end of every day, every week, every

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p27_c0
metadata.section_heading: misjudgment”; these are also known as the 25 cognitive biases or 25

content:
the most powerful part of human motivation. Create a reward system for
yourself. Reward yourself at the end of every day, every week, every
month, and every year. Create rewards that are beneficial for your health
and that are sustainable. Your rewards should be directly connected with
your results and your performance.
Association Bias
Associate your work with the results you want. When you are working and
feeling demotivated, try to associate the very process of your hard work
with the end goal you want to achieve. Reading the biographies and
autobiographies of accomplished individuals will help you to associate your
hardships with the hardships of those individuals.
Commitment and Consistency Bias

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p27_c1
metadata.section_heading: misjudgment”; these are also known as the 25 cognitive biases or 25

content:
Different studies show that people are more likely to implement some kind
of task or activity if they previously invested even the smallest portion of
their time, money, or effort in the activity. For example, if we pay for some
educational course, we are more likely to carefully work through the course
than we would if we had enrolled in the course for free. If we pay for
something, we value it more. Another example is that we are more likely to
buy a product in the supermarket if we taste a sample of the product. In
other words, once we begin doing something or pay for something, we are
much more likely to proceed.
Thus, we can use the commitment and consistency bias as an important
component in our motivation. The first step to motivate yourself to do

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p28_c0
metadata.section_heading: Different studies show that people are more likely to implement some kind

content:
Thus, we can use the commitment and consistency bias as an important
component in our motivation. The first step to motivate yourself to do
something is to just start. Once you have started, you can already use the
commitment and consistency bias. The second thing to do is to regularly
remind yourself how much time, effort, or money you have already invested
in the activity. The key is to make this process automatic and instinctual.
Loss Aversion Tendency
Behavioral economists have conducted a number of studies that show that
people are more driven and motivated by loss aversion than by reward
seeking. Particularly, people are more likely to take risks to prevent losses
than to acquire gains. Moreover, losses emotionally impact people twice as
much as gains.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p28_c1
metadata.section_heading: Different studies show that people are more likely to implement some kind

content:
than to acquire gains. Moreover, losses emotionally impact people twice as
much as gains.
To better illustrate this concept, let’s consider an example of motivating
yourself to switch time during a commute. To implement the loss aversion
tendency, you need to imagine how much knowledge you lose every minute
you are not listening to some educational audiobook while commuting. This

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p28_c2
metadata.section_heading: Different studies show that people are more likely to implement some kind

content:
reminder can serve as a strong additional motivator for you to switch time.
In other words, to motivate yourself effectively, focus on losses, not only on
gains.
Social Proof Bias
One of the most important motivators in our lives is our desire to be valued,
appreciated, and liked by other people. Social proof bias is one of the most
powerful in changing and leading human behavior. Often considered a
factor of decreasing human rationality, the social proof tendency can serve
as a highly important tool to increase rationality if used properly. Let’s
consider some practical examples of using social proof as a way to self-
motivate.
How can you motivate yourself to read and learn more?
Most people want to be interesting conversationalists. So, the more you

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p29_c0
metadata.section_heading: reminder can serve as a strong additional motivator for you to switch time.

content:
motivate.
How can you motivate yourself to read and learn more?
Most people want to be interesting conversationalists. So, the more you
read, the more knowledge you will have and the more interesting and well-
educated person you will become. I will give you a personal example: I
read a book a day. I read books from a wide range of subjects, including
biology, social psychology, economics, finance, health, etc. Thus, every day
I have many interesting stories to share with people.
How can you motivate yourself to give up bad habits?
Once you have decided to give up a bad habit, tell all of your friends and
acquaintances about it. The second step is to make everyday posts on social
media about your success in giving up the bad habit. To look good in the

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p29_c1
metadata.section_heading: reminder can serve as a strong additional motivator for you to switch time.

content:
acquaintances about it. The second step is to make everyday posts on social
media about your success in giving up the bad habit. To look good in the
eyes of your friends, you will force yourself to show others that you are a
person with strong willpower.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p29_c2
metadata.section_heading: reminder can serve as a strong additional motivator for you to switch time.

content:
Confirmation of Expectations Effect
In my own scientific studies in the field of behavioral economics, I have
analyzed the decision-making process of economic individuals. Among
many factors influencing an economic agent’s behavior, I have found one
particular factor to be highly interesting. After analyzing related papers on
the subject, I introduced my own name for this phenomenon: confirmation
of expectations effect (CEE). The essence of CEE can be presented in the
following simple way: people change their behavior after experiencing
confirmation or disconfirmation of their expectations. For example, if a
gambler expects to win a game and his expectations are confirmed, he is
likely to gamble even more money than before. The opposite is also true: If

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p30_c0
metadata.section_heading: Confirmation of Expectations Effect

content:
gambler expects to win a game and his expectations are confirmed, he is
likely to gamble even more money than before. The opposite is also true: If
a customer expects to be satisfied with a product and is not, he is less likely
to buy the product again. In other words, our behavior changes on the basis
of confirmation of our previous expectations.
So, how can we use CEE for self-motivation? The key is to concentrate our
attention on the results we expect and the results we achieve. In general, if
we educate ourselves more, we expect to know more, and as a result, earn
more money. To put it differently, we need to translate our knowledge into
our results, and this will motivate us to acquire more knowledge. This
process can be illustrated by the following scheme:

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p30_c1
metadata.section_heading: Confirmation of Expectations Effect

content:
our results, and this will motivate us to acquire more knowledge. This
process can be illustrated by the following scheme:
Expectations of Results → Self-Education → Knowledge → Results →
Confirmed Expectations → Motivation to Acquire Knowledge →
Expectations of Results

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p30_c2
metadata.section_heading: Confirmation of Expectations Effect

content:
Conclusion
Now it is time for action. At the beginning it will be difficult to implement
the methods described in this book, but after some practice you will form
habits that will change your life. As previously mentioned, two people with
the same capabilities can achieve different levels of success depending on
how they allocate and manage their time. Imagine how many books you can
read while other people just wait and do nothing meaningful. While others
use their headphones to listen to music, you can use your headphones to
gain knowledge shared by the world’s smartest people by listening to tens
or hundreds of audio books a year. Use every second by implementing the
method of time switching.
To develop habits for time switching, to form the most effective everyday

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p31_c0
metadata.section_heading: Conclusion

content:
method of time switching.
To develop habits for time switching, to form the most effective everyday
structure, and to figure out the best way to motivate yourself using the
behavioral approach, try different experiments and approaches. Analyze
your own behavior and habits. What bias affects your behavior the most?
Are you driven by social proof bias? Maybe you are mostly motivated by
reward bias. Experiment with different strategies.
Tell your friends about the concepts of time switching, everyday structure
and behavioral self-motivation. Show them this book, and discuss your
experiences using these methods. Share with them some stories about how
you read dozens of books or learned a foreign language by switching time.

metadata.source: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf
metadata.chunk_id: Time Switching The Advanced Method of Time Management for Self-Education (Sazonov, Victor) (Z-Library).pdf_p31_c1
metadata.section_heading: Conclusion

content:
One day you will switch time automatically. It will become instinctual for
you to use your phone to read a book while waiting in line or commuting.
You will read hundreds of books without effort every year. This method will
become a part of your lifestyle, your habits, and who you are. The results
for your life will be astonishing. Now you know how to switch your time
and invest it in yourself. Remember that mastery will not come
immediately, and the long journey begins with the first step. The time to
take this step is now!

metadata.section_heading: One day you will switch time automatically. It will become instinctual for
